conclusion: We have a parallel-plate capacitor with a charge +Q on one plate and -Q on the other plate, and a point charge q is placed at the midpoint between the plates.
The distance between the plates is d.
The electric field E between the plates of a parallel-plate capacitor is uniform and is given by E = V/d.
The potential difference V can be related to the charge Q and the capacitance C by V = Q/C.
The electric field E can be expressed as E = Q/(Cd).
The electrostatic force F experienced by a charge q in an electric field E is given by F = qE.
Substituting the expression for E, we get F = q(Q/(Cd)).
The magnitude of the electrostatic force experienced by the point charge q is F = qQ/(Cd).
